net.dean.jraw.models.meta

Class ModelManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.models.meta.ModelManager

  • public class ModelManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for managing the creation of JsonModels. It keeps a cache of common JsonSerializers and Model classes. This class is a singleton.

      • getInstance

      • create

        public static <T extends JsonModel> T create(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootNode,
                                             java.lang.Class<T> expectedClass)
        Convenience method equivalent to getInstance().parse(JsonNode, Class)

      • validate

        public void validate(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootNode,
                     java.lang.Class<?> expectedClass)
        Validates that the given JsonNode can be applied to the given class. If the value of Model.kind() does not match the value of the "kind" node, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        rootNode - The root node of the JSON model. Must contain two children: "kind" and "data".
        expectedClass - The class to use as validation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the root node does not have a "kind" node or if the expected value for that node was not found.

      • parse

        public <T extends JsonModel> T parse(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode rootNode,
                                     java.lang.Class<T> expectedClass)
        Parses a JsonNode into a JsonModel. The given class must be annotated with Model. If the Model's kind() is Model.Kind.ABSTRACT or Model.Kind.NONE, then the JsonNode will not be validated via validate(JsonNode, Class).
        Type Parameters:
        T - What type of JsonModel to return
        Parameters:
        rootNode - The root JSON node. Must contain two children: "data" and "kind", unless the Model's kind is Model.Kind.NONE
        expectedClass - The class to map this data to
        Returns:
        A new JsonModel
